senses.de: Something that is no longer in use or fashionable
senses.ex: Her computer is outdated because it can't run the latest software.

Tips.title: Technological Context
Tips.description: Use when discussing old technology that's replaced by newer inventions.
Tips.example: VHS tapes are outdated due to digital streaming services.

Tips.title: Fashion and Trends
Tips.description: Describes clothing or styles that are no longer popular.
Tips.example: Bell-bottom jeans are considered outdated in most fashion circles.

Tips.title: Avoid for People
Tips.description: Not polite to describe people as outdated, implies irrelevance.
Tips.example: Calling a dancer outdated is disrespectful; say their style is classic instead.

senses.de: Something that is no longer considered effective or useful
senses.ex: His management tips are outdated and don't work today's workplace

Tips.title: Relative Effectiveness
Tips.description: Indicates a method or idea that's been surpassed by better options.
Tips.example: Using a phone book to find a number is now outdated.

Tips.title: Modern Practices
Tips.description: Refers to practices that no longer align with current standards or expectations.
Tips.example: Outdated hiring practices can overlook talented candidates.

Tips.title: Updated Information
Tips.description: Information can be outdated if it doesn't reflect recent changes or data.
Tips.example: An atlas from the 1990s would have outdated country borders.

Ancient.wordDefinition:
Ancient refers to something that is very old, often with a sense of historical or cultural significance. For example, people might use ancient to describe the ruins of a long-dead civilization or a valuable artifact.

Ancient emphasizes the age and historical significance of something, while outdated emphasizes the fact that it is no longer relevant or useful in the present day.

Antiquated.wordDefinition:
Antiquated refers to something that is very old-fashioned or outdated, but still holds some historical or sentimental value.

For example, an antiquated piece of furniture might be an old wooden rocking chair that has been passed down through generations.

Antiquated suggests something old but charming, while outdated suggests something that is old and no longer useful.

Archaic.wordDefinition:
Archaic refers to something that is ancient or from an earlier time period. It typically carries a sense of importance or significance in history or culture.

In essence, archaic is a more specific and meaningful term, while outdated is a more general and neutral term. Archaic is applicable when discussing history or cultural heritage, while outdated is applicable when discussing things that have become irrelevant or replaced by newer alternatives.

Defunct.wordDefinition:
Defunct means that something is no longer functioning or operating. For example, a company that has gone out of business is defunct.

The difference between the two words is that defunct refers to something that has completely stopped existing, while outdated refers to something that is still around but is no longer useful or popular.

Defunct is applicable when something has ceased to exist, while outdated is applicable when something is old-fashioned or no longer relevant.

Extinct.wordDefinition:
Extinct refers to something that no longer exists, such as a species of animal that has died out completely. This term can also describe something that is no longer in use or available, such as a product that has been discontinued.

Extinct refers to something that no longer exists at all, whereas outdated refers to something that still exists but is no longer current or widely used.

Obsolete.wordDefinition:
Obsolete refers to something that is no longer in use or has been replaced by a newer and better version. For example, rotary phones are obsolete because most people use smartphones now.

So, while both terms signify something that is no longer current, obsolete is more precisely used when referring to something that is no longer used or no longer exists, while outdated refers to something that may still be in use but is considered outmoded or inferior compared to new things.

Outmoded.wordDefinition:
Both outdated and outmoded refer to something that is no longer useful or relevant.

Outmoded suggests that something is old-fashioned or obsolete. For example, an outmoded fashion trend would refer to something that is no longer popular or fashionable.

So, both words refer to something that is no longer useful or relevant, but outdated refers to something that is old and no longer in use while outmoded refers to something that is old-fashioned or obsolete.

Prehistoric.wordDefinition:
Prehistoric refers to things that existed before recorded history. This term describes things that are ancient and typically associated with early human cultures, such as prehistoric fossils or cave paintings.

Outdated refers to something that is old-fashioned while prehistoric refers to something that is very old and existed before recorded history.

Supersede.wordDefinition:
Supersede means that something newer, better, or more advanced has replaced or taken the place of something else. It implies that the old thing is no longer useful or necessary.

For example, digital cameras have superseded film cameras because they are easier to use and store photos on.

In simpler terms, outdated means old and not really useful anymore, while supersede means replaced by something better.

quotes.Text: I feel that we, as Indians, have a knack for loving a stereotypical, sobbing, sympathy-seeking personality. I feel that we need to promote quirky, cool and youthful talent. We have to stop propagating the sob-story angle of celebs, where they try to be larger-than-life. That is very outdated. It is so boring that it puts you to sleep.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Kangana Ranaut

quotes.Text: The world will try to make you think that being good is outdated and old-fashioned and that popularity comes from breaking the rules and lowering your standards. Don't buy into that way of thinking. As you watch TV or read magazines, you might be made to feel abnormal when, really, you are the one who has it figured out.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Margaret D. Nadauld

quotes.Text: If technology and communications can adapt to people's modern lifestyles, then why can't our labor laws follow suit? Private-sector businesses continue to live under an outdated federal mandate that says the only way to compensate for overtime is through cash wages.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Renee Ellmers

quotes.Text: China itself is now in the process of sloughing off not only the communist system, but also those outdated parts of Confucianism that prevent the rapid acquisition of knowledge needed to adjust to new ways of life and work.
quotes.Title: Statesman
quotes.Name: Lee Kuan Yew

quotes.Text: The NCAA model is outdated. If Steve Serby's a great player in high school, and an agent wants to represent you and wants to advance you money as a loan based on the fact that you're gonna be a high draft choice, so be it.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Dick Vitale

quotes.Text: As times change, so do the way each generation see the world. It is rather like the way our generation came to see our grandparents' views on the Empire and colonies as outdated.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: Douglas Alexander

quotes.Text: How can you consider flower power outdated? The essence of my lyrics is the desire for peace and harmony. That's all anyone has ever wanted. How could it become outdated?
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Robert Plant

quotes.Text: Building new roads and bridges creates jobs. Growing our exports creates jobs. Reforming our outdated tax system and our broken immigration system creates jobs.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Barack Obama

quotes.Text: I am passionate about acting. 'Girls in our family are not allowed to act' is quite an outdated thought to have. They did it till my mother, but now no more.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Kareena Kapoor Khan

quotes.Text: I always believe the rule by king or official leader is outdated. Now we must catch up with the modern world.
quotes.Title: Tibetan Leader
quotes.Name: Dalai Lama
